Caption: Figure 1: A screenshot from an analysis session where 2D scatterplots integrated with the Barnes and Roeder contours, triangle plots, spinel prisms and standard 2D scatterplots were used. One rectangular brush is active (red points).

Figure 2: (a) The spinel prism (b) The triangle plot showing Barnes and Roeder contours for basalts for the triangular projection of the prism. For this particular compositional field Barnes and Roeder de- fined two fields for 90th percentile contours (light blue) and three fields for 50th percentile contours (dark blue) .

Figure 3: Contour Brush. On the left, a contour brush is active se- lecting all the points that fall into the 90th percentile contour of the enclosing contour. On the right the corresponding convex contour is drawn.
